website_summaries.verdict: Performance-wise, the Dunham Cloud Waterproof boot has delivered excellently. It was well-received for out-of-the-box comfort and satisfactory ankle support. It was also liked for its lightness, spacious toe room, and waterproofing. Despite these exceptional features, it failed in the durability section. By and large, the Cloud Waterproof from Dunham is a pair of leather trail boots that’s more likely to please with its pros. The reported cons, however, will give interested buyers something to ponder.
pros: Based on a lot of user reviews, the Dunham Cloud Waterproof is one of the best comfortable hiking boots they have ever worn
Its zero break-in time has impressed numerous owners
This Dunham product accommodates custom orthotics pretty well, according to more than a handful
Many wearers and an expert laud its lightweight build
It runs true to size, as testified by a significant percentage of users
Some verified purchasers appreciate its ample toe room
This waterproof hiking shoe has received commendations from a handful of wearers as it is able to keep their feet from getting wet
A professional gear reviewer mentions that the Cloud Waterproof boot renders adequate ankle support
cons: A considerable number of owners are frustrated when the sole of the Dunham Cloud Waterproof separated from the upper after a few months of moderate use
Its outsole lacks traction and collects dirt, say several disappointed wearers
Less than a handful are dismayed when the stitching at the forefoot unravels too soon

customer_reviews.title: the fit and support has been great and consistent
customer_reviews.text: I've worn this model of Dunham shoe for several years because of the availability of widths (I need narrow) and half sizes....the fit and support has been great and consistent, pair to pair. That said, this most recent pair that I purchased (delivered on February 4th) had one of the metal eyelets pull out yesterday (3/27/16). I'm disappointed that the return for a genuinely defective product is limited to 30 days (from Amazon)...and I will attempt to take this up directly with New Balance/Dunham to see if they offer some exchange for this pair.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Carney

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th pair of Dunhams. Usually, they last several years. My newest pair (purchased in September developed a tear right through the side which makes them unwearable. As you can see from the picture, these were not heavily used and are still looking like new except for the tear. Very disappointed and will never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Cory C. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Just Crap
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are crap!! I have had several pair on recommendation of orthotic maker and i'm DONE!! The soles just squish down and curve in a month and the stitching loosens I kept trying I feel like a fool But i was told I won't find anything better because i am a big person .....Ya that was BS Bought IRISH SETTERs Best in a long time Don't buy these they are overpriced JUNK oh and they aren't even close to waterproof
customer_reviews.author: Spending_Problem

customer_reviews.title: Decent boot, not heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as it's supposed to have good pronation control. It's not bad, not as good as I was hoping, but that on me. The bigger issue is the sole. These are not heavy duty boots. They are good for light hiking or walking, but not for anything more extreme. Such as an industrial facility with nothing but asphalt, concrete, and metal stairs all day long. The sole is too flexible for a rough environment. but they are nice boots, just not heavy duty. I cant talk about how waterproof as I've not tried them in rain or wet conditions yet. They are well made, and fit how they should.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Fourth pair; none better
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my fourth pair of of these in a size 14 EEEE over the last five years. I'm a BIG guy and wear a custom orthotic with a ridge across the ball of my foot (that tends to compress down into the midsole) so I go through boots quickly. My podiatrist recommended them, and anymore I just reorder because I've never found anything better. I can get a little better than a year out of a pair where I used to have to dump others after 6-9 months. I'd probably get more time out of them if I bought two pairs and alternated them, but, well, just haven't done that. :-) Great boot!
customer_reviews.author: Donald D. Morissette

customer_reviews.title: Good walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Replacing a pair of Propet walking boots. The Dunham fit better, feel better and I can wear them longer. The appearance is very acceptable. They look like hiking boots even though they are just walking shoes. Have taken several long walks in them and they are very comfortable. Additionally I use podiatrist inserts that take up a lot of space. The Dunham"s easily accommodate my inserts and still have room to spare. The feel is soft as you walk, but on rough surface plenty of strength to smooth out the path. If they hold up I will buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Tallness

customer_reviews.title: I have twice ordered a 10. 5 (M) boot ...
customer_reviews.text: I have twice ordered a 10.5 (M) boot through Amazon because virtually all reviews said that the boots are a half or more too small than the stated size (I normally take a size 10). Twice I have been sent a size 10.5 (B) which is much too narrow for my foot. I will try to get a replacement one more time after which I will just abandon this product, regrettably.
customer_reviews.author: Inigo Montoya

customer_reviews.title: The ankle support and traction are very good. So far
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy this boot for traditional hiking, but rather for doing lawn mowing and yard work on uneven, sloping ground. I was looking for higher ankle support than in a typical shoe. The fit was as expected even with my arch supports. The ankle support and traction are very good. So far, they have been very comfortable to wear. My only concern is that the metal lace eyelets do not have rounded edges. It appears that those edges may eventually cut into the laces, but that's just my observation. I haven't worn them enough times to know if that will eventually happen or not.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A

customer_reviews.title: !!!HORRIBLE QUALITY...AFTER 15 DAYS EYELET PULLED OUT...HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!
customer_reviews.text: After wearing these shoes for only FIFTEEN TIMES the eyelet pops out. I figured that I would see if the manufacturer would have integrity and stand behind their product...NOPE!!! !!!DUNHAM / ROCKPORT SHOES DO NOT STAND BEHIND THEIR PRODUCT!!! I get a return email from Yania at their "Customer Service" department that essentially said...take it to a local shoe repair and pay to have them fix it...TOO BAD SOO SAD IT SUCKS TO BE YOU FOR BUYING OUR JUNK PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.author: William Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Good for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I found this on a list of boots for sufferers of plantar fasciitis and using Prime Wardrobe I ordered 4 different boots off of the list to try in the house when I was in pain, when I wasn't, before work, after work etc. to find the boots that seemed the best in all situations and these are the winner! Fit well, true to size, well made and good looking. Everyone at the warehouse wants to know what brand and where they cam from etc. They're seemingly expensive but your feet are worth taking care of believe me!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Sink

customer_reviews.title: but it very good. Just started hiking in the new pair and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I've bought. I bought the first pair about 6 months ago. I do a lot of hiking during the week and even more on weekends (perhaps average about 25 - 30 miles per week). I've bought some real lemons in the past, but these shoes have held up very well. I was a little concerned since I hadn't heard of the Dunham brand before, but it very good. Just started hiking in the new pair and they're just as good. The old pair are my new backup boots. Give them a try...
customer_reviews.author: David K. in Great Falls, VA

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I hiked 14 miles from the entrance of Crater Lake National Park in Oregon, up to the lake (1000 ft extra elevation), and then back to the entrance to the park again - in the middle of winter. My body overall was in the most horrible pain BUT my feet were just fine. In my life, I have repeatedly had foot pain problems in the forward part of my feet, but NOT when I am wearing these Dunham Cloud shoes. The "Cloud" name is apropos.
customer_reviews.author: Godspeed

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, I had to order 1 size longer
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoe fine. I usually wear a 13 B (Narrow). This shoe was OK width wise but I found that the 13 was a bit short. I re-ordered the shoe in a size 14 & it fit. If there had been 1/2 sizes probably a 13 and 1/2 would have sufficed. I am pleased with the shoe there is really no real break-in period, of course any shoe feels better after it has been worn a few months. I have not had them that long and can not speak to the longevity aspect of how long they hold up. Overall I am very pleased with the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nice and LIght But Do Not Hold Up
customer_reviews.text: My husband's size 13 A foot is not easy to fit, so I was pretty pleased to find these comfy shoes for him. Unlike most boots his size, these are light. The problem is, he's had three pairs and none of them last more than three or four months. He's not particularly hard on them, wears them to work, goes up and down a lot of stairs and does a great deal of standing. Even so, for an average price of $140 I think they should last at least six months. A shame.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Arscott

customer_reviews.title: These are not the same quality as before
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair in 2016 and after years of hiking, reordered a new pair of the same boots. After a month (and after the return window closed) the uppers are de-laminating. Haven't had much chance to hike yet this year and they are in worse shape then the boots I bought in Dec 2016. Waiting to hear back from Rockport about getting my money back. Utterly unhappy. A solid chunk of change with no certainty that I'll get the money back.
customer_reviews.author: Paul G. Davitt

customer_reviews.title: comfortable from the outset and a narrow width fits my ...
customer_reviews.text: Dunham boots are not cheap, but I have found them to be comparable to boots costing $100 more. They're well made, comfortable from the outset and a narrow width fits my size A foot without the need to spend more on an extra narrow boot. This is my second set of hiking boots and I find then as comfortable on the streets of Manhattan as on the trail. Kudos to New Balance for making such an excellent boot.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L.

customer_reviews.title: Finally a boot that feels good from the start!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been in lawn care for the past 25 years and in all that time, he has worn and worn out numerous pairs of boots that hurt his feet all day long. He has a high instep and a wide toe box and finding boots wide enough was almost impossible until we found these. Right out of the box, the shoes were wide enough and lightweight, too, with speed hooks and the right kind of sole and foot pad. Everything he wanted and needed for his diabetic feet! Will be ordering another pair as a spare!!
customer_reviews.author: June Garner

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted for 2.5 months
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for my husband August 2019, only 2.5 months ago and ankle support has worn out and the caption was that he was to feel like he was "walking on a Cloud" that never happened. He has started looking for another pair of boots. His occupation is Electrical and he is on his feel all day long. Rubber is separating on the outside of the boot. Do not recommend for work. Shoestrings tore within a month of wearing.
customer_reviews.author: j.craney

customer_reviews.title: This might be a good option for folks with wide feet
customer_reviews.text: This might be a good option for folks with wide feet, but it doesn't fit people with narrow feet, despite it being sold in a "narrow" version. I bought the narrow version in size 13. It's too wide and roomy for my truly narrow (B width) foot. The boot is not actually narrow; it fits like a medium width (D width) boot rather than a true B width narrow boot. It's also very roomy over the instep and toebox. I imagine that their "medium" width boot is actually an E width, and they made a "narrow" version of it that is more like a D width.
customer_reviews.author: RoverCyclist

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son who studies Geology. These boots are perfect for his adventures in the Smoky Mountains and everywhere else his adventures have led. He wears a size 16, and these boots fit perfectly. He didn’t have to break them in before using. He’s had them for almost a year and they are still in great condition, including the tread. He has requested another pair for future use.
customer_reviews.author: Candi

customer_reviews.title: Cadillacs for your feet.
customer_reviews.text: I can't really speak to how well these shoes perform in severe environments, but in my case I use them as rain boots and so far they've worked great in keeping water, mud and dirt out. The tongue sewn into the top of the shoe as a single piece, so you can stand in water up to the top rivet and still keep dry. Most importantly, these shoes are really spacious and confortable: They feel great since the first time and there's no need to break them in.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great Winter Waterproof Boot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my stepfather. He is a diabetic and has trouble with is feet, sometimes. He said the shoe was comfortable and kept his feet warm when we went to Denver. The quality of the shoe is nice; it is made well. My father has a some what wide foot and he did not feel his feet were crammed in the shoe. I bought him wool diabetic socks and he said the shoe still felt good on even with the socks. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: McGeHee24

customer_reviews.title: No Support
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots because I suffer from supplication, my weight is on the outside of the foot. I purchased them in April, 2019 but only wore them around the house and they felt good. Now that it's getting cold out I started wearing them for a complete day. There is no support to the outside of the foot and the arch is too high. They don't come close to be a corrective or supporting boot for folks experiencing supination...waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: Finally One That Fits
customer_reviews.text: I live in Colorado where hiking is very popular. My feet are very narrow "B" width and I have not been able to find hiking shoes that fit snug enough to keep my feet from slopping around in them. I have received a pair of Duham's narrow width shoes and the fit is very nice. I have not had the opportunity to hit the trail in earnest yet, but so far they feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Laux

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots because of the ratings and because I read that they are made by New Balance, a brand I've always had good luck with. They fit well and were very comfortable. Unfortunately they are not waterproof. As in; walking through wet grass and end up with damp feet not waterproof. Such a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndia63

customer_reviews.title: First of seven pair that "failed
customer_reviews.text: I buy this shoe as it provides excellent support and is durable. This pair, shown in the photos above, did not live up to the high standards of Durham shoes and of the 7 pair we have purchased are the only ones that we had issues with other than wearing out the sole -- to be expected. You can see in the photos that the upper portion is coming apart and will have to be replaced. We purchased this pair in November -- so about 90 days worth of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Dola D. Handley

customer_reviews.title: 150 dollar hiking boots with a 50 cent insoles, ...
customer_reviews.text: 150 dollar hiking boots with a 50 cent insoles, because I have wide foot I buy shoes slightly larger than my actual size these run far more narrow than any other 4e I buy from red wing etc. Overall not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Keegan

customer_reviews.title: Returning them was easy though, so it was not a problem
customer_reviews.text: I read somewhere in one of the reviews that they fit a 1/2 size or a whole size too small. For my husband this was not the case. I bought a size bigger and they had to be returned for his real size. Returning them was easy though, so it was not a problem. Hubby says they are incredibly comfortable as he works on a cement floor all day and he has no issues with them. We will definitely be buying these boots again.
customer_reviews.author: PJHANSON

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and fits wider feet: would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Wore this for a couple years ago for an outside rainy job, and they actually became my casual shoes. Especially accommodated for my wide feet and tall arch, which made them my casual of choice. They are reliable and the grip is still functional: will consider buying these again! One star off because the seal at opposite sides of the ‘Vamp’ of the shoe (above the ball of the foot) started to break, along with the rubber part around the toe area on the outside. This is, however, after near two years of good use, and was patched easy enough with shoe sealing product.
customer_reviews.author: Luc Demoulin

customer_reviews.title: Good for Supinators
customer_reviews.text: I supinate. I read that this boot was good for supinators. It seems to be better than all the work boots I have worn in the past. The pain in the outside balls of my feet (particularly the left one) is much less....but still there. Shoe is light weight. I like it a lot.....if only it would eliminate my left foot pain I'd give it six stars.
customer_reviews.author: bearridge

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe... HORRIBLE SHOE LACES
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe. Have narrow feet and it's the best fitting shoe I've ever purchased. So I bought two pair. :) Since I wear them everyday... one to work, the other to do yard work in and house rennovations... they both get a lot of use. You would think that for $144 they would provide decent shoe laces... but they don't. I didn't let that effect my score but be prepared to replace those shoe laces 6 months after you buy the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Flaherty

customer_reviews.title: 4 months of wear now.
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots until they wear out. (About month 6.) Great arch and ankle support. One of the most comfortable work boot that I own. Rotating them with a second pair will extend their life to 18 months. Warning, very slick on fuel spills. February 2020., Completely shot in 4 months. Heal is coming apart, stitching on the side of the boot is coming apart and the metal shaft in the boot has broken and now pokes into the bottom of my foot. To spend for only 4 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: MoBee

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Boots and will not but from Shoe Mart Inc
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these boots if you are expecting them to hold up to strenuous hiking of any sort. Mine have split at the seems that I feel was a manufacturer defect and have contacted the reseller Shoe Mart Inc about the issue and as of this time refuse to help or offer an exchange. I will not be buying from either Shoe Mart Inc or Dunham boots ever again.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL P PETERSON

customer_reviews.title: Coming apart at the seam...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were delivered less than 4 months ago and my husband was so happy with the way they fit and the comfort. He wears them every day to work 8:00-5:00 at the garden center. (No mud, nor excessive wetness). It’s not easy to find shoes (work/casual) to fit his 10N feet. When he showed me where the seam is coming apart already I couldn’t believe it since I paid $160.08 ($144.95 plus tax). I would like to know if there is any guarantee for these expensive work shoes that are coming apart at the seams. Amazon? Dunham?
customer_reviews.author: Debra Norton

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Replacing an existing pair of same shoe. Only glitch was Amazon sizing didn’t match “D” in the shoes I have. Turned out to be Medium, which was the size that was identified as just “9”. (There was Something like: 9 narrow, 9, 9 wide, 9 extra wide). Vendor cleared it up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bamford

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, fits
customer_reviews.text: One of the few pairs of comfortable narrow hiking boots I've found in my size. The heels don't wear well, and I've had little luck getting comfortable heel replacements. The rest of the boot appears to be strong - I wish the heels were better. Thicker bottom rubber layer?
customer_reviews.author: Nobody

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boots so Far
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 10 1/2 4E Dunham Men's Cloud Mid-Cut Waterproof Boot fits which fits as expected. I have a difficult time finding shoes in 4E so I was pleasantly surprised to find a boot by New Balance. I have been wearing my boots to break them in for a trip to Zimbabwe. They are very comfortable, and appear very durable. I'll be spending ten days in the bush veld so only time will tell whether they truly are durable. I recommend Dunham Men's Cloud Mid-Cut Boot especially if you have wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: it's comfortable and fits my narrow foot very well but not suited to my walk.
customer_reviews.text: Other than a sole that is slippery on smooth, wet surfaces and a noisy one too when walking on hard surface floors, squeak, squeak, it's comfortable and fits my narrow foot very well. Update: I did not wear the shoes until leaving on a vacation trip and after wearing for two weeks, I found this shoe to aggravate an old sciatic nerve issue. I have never had this issue with my usual Danner boots. Lesson learned, don't wait until there are no other options until wearing a pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Newbie DIYer

customer_reviews.title: No arch support
customer_reviews.text: My husband had what seemed like the very same hiking boot from New Balance. He loved them and got over a decade of wear from them. This boot is made very well but lacks arch support which is a prime concern since he has a high arch. We are returning them for this reason and will have to visit the local shoe store.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Brazes

customer_reviews.title: Width does not match size chart
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the boot in a 14 XW and received the 2E width. According to the size chart the shoe should have been a 3E with the 2E listed as just W. It is a very nice boot but had to return due to being too narrow in the toe box. Based on my experience not sure if it possible to get the 3E indicated in the chart.
customer_reviews.author: Rimas P.

customer_reviews.title: Correction !! Order your correct size and you'll be very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: These are VERY comfortable and very well made heavy duty shoe, these are not what I'd call a hiking boot BUT you decide. After reading other reviews I ordered a size up, that was a mistake, these fix perfect because I also wear a pair of real wool socks, for summer use I'll order my correct size.
customer_reviews.author: David White

customer_reviews.title: Thought I was buying a quality boot for the price ...
customer_reviews.text: Thought I was buying a quality boot for the price I paid . Not the case ! I have worn theses boots maybe a dozen times . They have become delaminated from the soles not one but both . My feet get wet walking on wet grass . Defiantly not worth the money .
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Hennis

customer_reviews.title: Good for working in
customer_reviews.text: I love the fit of the shoe. It could use a better cushioned insert. Even though the old pair of shoes are 4 years old, I didn't expect it to tear open at a sewn seam just above the sole and it can't be repaired. That makes me a bit hesitant to repurchase another pair. The new shoes are a bit snug if they stretch out like my older ones I would give them 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Vilch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent comfort and water protection
customer_reviews.text: I took these on my recent trip to Iceland, and aside from a day in Reykjavik, these were the only shoes I wore on my 6 day trip. These are very comfortable all day long and fit my super wide feet perfectly. My feet did get a bit wet once when I got a bit too cavalier in my trek out in a river and submerged my feet up to the laces, but I regularly had water up to the sides and my feet stayed bone dry. Thank you for taking the time to read my review. If you found it helpful, please let me know by selecting "yes" below.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but short lived
customer_reviews.text: I am on my 3rd pair of these boots and love the way they fit and feel. My only complaint is that I only get about 9 months use and they become uncomfortable. I do weigh 250lb and that may have something to do with it. I also have a pair of Carolina boots. They are very comfortable and have lasted for over 2 years of winter use but are very heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Gutter Guy

customer_reviews.title: Love the look
customer_reviews.text: I don't believe these are truly 4E as I ordered and as labeled. Love the look, but a little snug even with thin socks. I have 3E feet and wanted something extra wide to wear thick wool socks with. Hopefully these will feel better after I wear them a bit.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: Fits/feels fine. But I bought these because it was offered in a narrow size, which is almost unheard of. But they didn't feel any more narrow than standard-width boots. Also, didn't care for the suede material. Odd choice for a waterproof work boot/hiker as it's a magnet for dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Working man

customer_reviews.title: The BEST hiking equipment for WIDE feet
customer_reviews.text: My size 12 feet are so wide I can wear EEEEE shoes or sneakers. About two years ago I bought these in 12 4E, and they are still going strong. Unlike the soles of most hiking boots, the edges of these Dunhams curve up a bit, which adds stability as you hike over rocks and uneven surfaces. They are not completely waterproof, but my socks don't get wet from splashing through 2" puddles. They keep my feet warm in snow, and on hot California desert hikes my feet don't feel overheated. I wish these awesome shoes would start to fall apart so I can buy another pair!
customer_reviews.author: Lawyer4Free

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these shoes that I've purchased. I have wide feet so I'm constantly on the look out for anything that fits my feet, are well made and don't hurt my feet anymore than they already do. These fit the bill perfectly. They're durable, wear well, are water resistant. I've done some light hiking and of course a crap ton of work around our home. Very good shoes. If New Balance stil made decent shoes - they would've made these.
customer_reviews.author: richard j moon

customer_reviews.title: Hard to complain
customer_reviews.text: This boot is amazing for the price. Fits perfect and the water proofing works well. My only complaints are the soles are hard and will require your own and the tread is not slip resistant. You'd think a hiking boot would be slip resistant but I have trouble finding traction on surfaces with the slightest amount of moisture on them.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: VERY comfortable, fit well, but quality is still unknown.
customer_reviews.text: Don't do a lot of reviews, but this is THE MOST COMFORTABLE PIECE of FOOTWEAR I've ever owned. That's probably as much my fault -- having 3X+ wide feet and buying whatever the store had, but went looking for a "workboot" and most were 2X, which I've finally figured out is uncomfortable. Worn them most days for 2 weeks and will probably buy a 2nd pair -- however, I've just noticed the bottom (sole) of one of them is peeling back from the top (unglued), which after only 2 weeks is REALLY disappointing. Amazon is replacing (thank you Amazon !) and hopefully the 2nd pair will hold up longer. Hoping the separation.is a fluke as I really like these. boots.
customer_reviews.author: B Woods

customer_reviews.title: Durable, stain & water-resistant, supportive, comfortable, well-made
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my teenage son who wears 10.5 4E (very hard to find). He loves them. We had another rough winter in OH-IO and these have served him well. He's worn them to school, on dates, out & about, and even for farm work. I worried they'd never be presentable again after he wore them to power wash a tractor and combine (a filthy job), but he wiped them down and they look like new. I highly recommend these based on how he says they feel, how often he wears them, and how they still look despite being owned by a rough young man.
customer_reviews.author: brooksj

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Show
customer_reviews.text: This show is very comfortable, it was very roomy for my foot. It could use a little more grip on the sole of the show, but for everyday use, it should be fine. It was nice to be able to find a size 16 extra wide shoe, they are hard to come by.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Klug

customer_reviews.title: 5 Plus Stars Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Lasted for only 9 months. Did not use these for hiking due to flat treads. Used for urban walking. Rubber separated from leather on left boot after 9 months. Right boot is still in excellent condition. I contacted ROCKPORT.COM and within a week I had a new pair of boots. Excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J Aurilio

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves them
customer_reviews.text: My husband is very picky. I read the reviews and took a leap of faith and purchased. He loves them. Like all the other reviewers he says they are extremely comfortable and durable. He has trouble finding the right size and these were on the money. Well made mid sized boots. Bought the grey and they were more of an Olive with brown accents. They look great with any color pants. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sue She

customer_reviews.title: GREAT QUALITY BOOT AND FITS TRUE TO SIZE. VERY COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent quality shoes. The problem is my feet are hard to fit. I wear a 12EEE. Although I purchased the wide fit they're slightly tight on my feet although I can get through the day with them. I'm glad to get them off after about 8 hours. These is a great quality shoe and I will consider repurchase. Great arch support and initially very comfortable fit. Most people will not have a problem with the fit of this boot. They fit true to size so consider when you purchase. Wish someone would make a 12EEE.
customer_reviews.author: Memphis Music Man

customer_reviews.title: a bit expensive
customer_reviews.text: Wore them all last winter with thick socks. Bought another brand for warm weather use which was half the cost and would likely purchase that rather than these because of the soul bottoms grip will last longer
customer_reviews.author: jsigur

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy waterproof men's hiker that comes in narrow widths
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of the Dunham Cloud shoes that my husband has bought. Oddly, the latest pair was slightly shorter in length than the previous pair, same size. We returned the 10.5B shoes for an 11B pair, which fit fine. The first pair was purchased over a year ago. Kudos to the seller, A Perfect Dealer, for working with us to find the perfect size. My husband depends on his thrice-weekly walks to maintain his health at 80, and loves this particular model shoe as they are waterproof and come in narrow widths.
customer_reviews.author: Susan J. H.

customer_reviews.title: These are great looking shoes this is the second pair I bought ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great looking shoes this is the second pair I bought the first pair was comfortable but after a short time wearing them the seam came apart wear the toe area bends, I wasnt happy however they did fit nice. Now two month after I bought my second pair the same thing happened and of course the return policy is not in affect. I won't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... a quality shoe but not any more they fit great I'm on my feet all day on construction sites ...
customer_reviews.text: Have been wearing Merrill boots for years but no they seem to break down after a few months and stretch out don't fit right so I got these to try something new hopefully they will out last the Merrill which used to be a quality shoe but not any more they fit great I'm on my feet all day on construction sites haven't had them long enough to actually tell how they will hold up over time but I'm hoping they will last through the winter at least
customer_reviews.author: Ron rose

customer_reviews.title: Love the Clouds.
customer_reviews.text: Love the Clouds. I have 4 pair in various states of wear and dirtiness, from office wear, lawn mowing, winter salt encrusted, and a pair for mud use. Cant seem to throw a pair out, they just move down the chain of where I can wear them. Waterproofing never wears off. They do run a little warm in the summer, being waterproof with no vent holes or mesh. I don't mind that too much, knowing I can walk in the wet morning grass without getting soggy socks. Hope they never stop making the Cloud model.
customer_reviews.author: BerettaBill

customer_reviews.title: flat and narrow? these are for you
customer_reviews.text: I read the few reviews and ordered them. I too have narrow feet. I'm 6'5" 200lb and have skies for feet - not to mention their flat as can be. The reviews I read are spot on... I slipped my feet into these and YEAH! Happy feet... I'll be buying another pair of these when they wear out. I use them as work boots as I am a flooring contractor and just try buying a narrow work boot... Not a chance.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer and applier

customer_reviews.title: My friend loved these
customer_reviews.text: We found they run a size small, so we returned and reordered a size up. That having been done, the shoe were exactly the durability and versatility we sought for country living.
customer_reviews.author: Always Asking

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, small sizes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these trying to find a narrow boot for work. The first pair I ordered where the size i where but where too tight in the toe so I ordered a replacement in the next size up. This have lasted me about 4 days of wear. I just noticed today that they ripped out on the inside so now I'm stuck trying to find a boot that will work again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Better than the original
customer_reviews.text: I had worn out two pairs of the previous versions of this boot. The third pair has gotten too small as I age. These are every bit as high quality and well engineered as the original versions, and this new tread is even more stable and grippy on rocky trails and desert sand. If they ever stop making this boot I'll sue for damages. FYI: I wear a 13B now, and for narrow heels like mine no other boot comes close to fitting as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cato The Eldest

customer_reviews.title: Ankle support is better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit the same as any other New Balance shoe. Arch support seems adequate. Ankle support is better than expected. Waterproofing will keep your feet dry through deep puddles, but you'll still get soaking wet if walking in the rain (this is consistent with all waterproof shoes IMO). I'm only giving it 4 stars because I had to send my first pair back after a seam split within 25mi of use in the first two weeks that I owned them. Amazon was great about me returning them and the new shoes seem to be holding up fine.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: great work boots
customer_reviews.text: High quality product. haven't had to break them in. very comfortable from the time I put them on I stand on my feet 8 to 10 hours a day and I feel really nice
customer_reviews.author: Craig ebert

customer_reviews.title: Narrow fit compared to regular shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these boots. They look nice and feel well made. Unfortunately, their definition of "wide" and mine are different. I wear New Balance 12 2E shoes almost all the time. I figured these would use similar sizes since the company is owned by New Balance, but these shoes in a 12 Wide size would barely go on my foot. Very narrow for a boot.
customer_reviews.author: Phil W.

customer_reviews.title: They feel great for all day wear.
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like these boots. I'm on my feet all day on concrete in a cabinet shop. Outside some unloading trucks. They are a good buy for the money and comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne E Clark

customer_reviews.title: Love Them!
customer_reviews.text: Great price on the gray set. They fit perfect and I have a 4E wide foot. Laces didn't hold up and had to replace them, but otherwise they are super comfortable as I frequently walk 3+ miles in them. Dry and warm.
customer_reviews.author: bannatyne

customer_reviews.title: but they feel comfortable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have only worn these shoes for a few days, but they feel comfortable and sturdy. I ordered these shoes larger than I normally use because shoes I have bought recently all seem smaller than they use to be. They are a half size larger then I thought I should use and they fit well. Time will tell how well they hold up so I will add to this review some time later.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Shircliff

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in the quality of the shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the quality of the shoes. In less than 5 months of daily use one of the seams has torn open, both laces have needed replacement and the uppers are showing significant wear. I was hoping to at least make it to the end of the year with the boots, but will need to replace them sooner. The only positive is that they did fit my 4E foot well. Too bad they are so poorly constructed.
customer_reviews.author: A. FELLENZ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit/Great Sole
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of this boot. Bought the third pair as a primary to add to the second pair for a motorcycle road trip. Nothing wrong with the 2nd pair; just wanted extra pair in case of rain. The sole on this boot has outstanding grip. Very important in hiking or motorcycle riding.
customer_reviews.author: Towdude

customer_reviews.title: During heavy rains my property gets like a sponge and these boots keep my feet dry ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these boots I have ordered. The first pair is 3 years old. I wear them in the evenings when I get home and on the weekends. They are not fully waterproof, but didn't really expect them to be because any boot with a regular tongue will leak water. During heavy rains my property gets like a sponge and these boots keep my feet dry 90% of the time. They are comfortable and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: R. Close

customer_reviews.title: With is actually wide
customer_reviews.text: A bit pricey probably won't repeat this order needed in a pinch. 2nd pair first pair got wet one to many times. To be fair I'm hard on shoes these last 6 to 8 months and the xtra wide with are at least a 3e after about 6 months the glue comes undone and easy to get wet. But I'm a mechanic so I'm hard on shoes . probably gonna go with red wing next
customer_reviews.author: robert Doolittle

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit. Nice shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes for about a week. They're replacing an older pair of Dunhams that have passed the "Shoes-of-Theseus" stage, well on their way across the river Styx. I like the way they fit and feel. No blisters, no rubbing or bad fit. No nasty new-shoe smell. Grommets well placed. Padding where you need it. I like the clean design and tread pattern. I'm not sure how long the laces will last, but so far, I'm a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Laughter on Water

customer_reviews.title: An underrated hiker that's available in extra wide!
customer_reviews.text: I expected it to be a little narrow, and it was - I wear a 12 3E normally and this is perfect (with hiking socks) in a 12 4E size for me. It's a super comfy and very well made shoe. I've been wearing it walking around on my feet for two days and it's great. It makes me want to go hiking. There's only small rock stuff I can do here, and they're very good. I am impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Corrieri

customer_reviews.title: Click Clack
customer_reviews.text: Not long after wearing these boots something broke in the sole of the boot and now when I walk it makes a loud, annoying clicking sound. It's hard to find a good casual boot. These looked nice on line but the click . . . ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: These shoes fit great with my special orthotics
customer_reviews.text: I have a condition called Charcot Marie Tooth, with a Pes Cavus arch. These shoes fit great with my special orthotics. Hopefully I might also as this progresses need AFO's special braces. I purchased these on a review of someone who has my condition also. I got a 4E as I do with most of my footwear and these do run a bit wide, but my feet do swell and overall would not want anything "slimmer".
customer_reviews.author: william fox

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable pair of hiking boots that I have ever worn!
customer_reviews.text: I have been hiking in these for over a month. Day trips on the weekends only. So far they have been waterproof in the snow and a teeny bit of rain and creek. The wide (4E) size is a true Godsend. Thank you, Dunham for the most comfortable pair of hiking boots (or any footwear, for that matter) that I have ever worn!
customer_reviews.author: ANDY KAZ

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I have very wide feet and have difficulty finding shoes that don't hurt. I bought these in 11 4E and wore them for a solid 6 hours today, both sitting and standing / walking. Never bothered me once, which is a minor miracle. I can't attest to their ruggedness or waterproof design yet, but will be taking them with me to the Seattle area next week. So far, I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Guitarzan

customer_reviews.title: WATERPROOF?????????????
customer_reviews.text: I have bought New Balance products for many years, because of the narrow lasts. I bought these a year ago. I wore them around town to break them in. The first time I traveled back to my home in Alaska & stepped in 3" of water, they leaked at the tongue almost immediately. WaterProof???????? However, I called New Balance & I told them what had happened & they said thank you for your feedback & hung up. WOW Have things changed.
customer_reviews.author: Tsirkur

customer_reviews.title: coming apart with very little wear
customer_reviews.text: not impressed with the quality of the construction of this shoe. the stitching's are starting to come apart. I have not taken this shoe off road yet, have worn it indoors only on carpeted floors. I expected a better quality thinking it was associated with new balance. cannot honestly recommend the shoe. total time wearing is day hours for less than 21 days.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, but poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these boots, the first pair lasted a couple of years, I purchased this pair in August 2019, and by mid December the sole of the right boot has separated from the boot itself along the inside front edge, the separation is now about 5 inches long, and the boot is unwearable. I am going to attempt a repair using shoe goo or a similar product
customer_reviews.author: Terrence R. Bayne

customer_reviews.title: Same look, different feel, not good!!
customer_reviews.text: These are not the same Dunham Clouds that they use to produce with New Balance, what a shame!! They didn't feel nearly as good as the old style. When you have bad feet the fit and feel of a shoe is so important and for some reason manufacturers can't leave a good thing alone. I was very disappointed. Returned them immediately
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: Good boots
customer_reviews.text: I have very wide feet. Usually 11.5 4Es are too narrow for me. I ordered these in a size 13 4E. The toe box is wide enough and the length is actually ok. I had to put in separate inner soles with some preshaped arch support to them. The inner soles that come with the shoes are flat, with no arch support. Not sure why shoe manufacturers don't include inner soles with proper arch support, but no one does. Not going to downgrade the shoes just for that.
customer_reviews.author: frank lindemann

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy at this point and will write again in a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these daily for about a week and all I can say at this point is "WOW". They fit as I had hoped with regard to width and arch support as I need a little extra width and arch support. I predominately wear this type of shoe while I am in hot desert type areas and was hoping that they would be lighter than normal desert boots, while keeping the support and being able to take the rough conditions. I am very happy at this point and will write again in a couple of months to attest to the durability of these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, but I did size up a bit.
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I checked previous reviews, I see that it does fit a bit small, I normally wear 15B with thick socks, I ordered a 16B and they fit perfectly. These are currently my most comfortable daily shoe. I still have a very old pair of clouds in a 15B, but they actually fit a bit bigger than these, but the newer pair are definitely more comfortable and lighter than the older style. I whish they were just a bit higher above the ankles like the older style was, but that's my only gripe.
customer_reviews.author: DWARFBUG

customer_reviews.title: Fits Duck Feet Well
customer_reviews.text: Have done about 50 miles in these by now. I have very wide feet. These are comfortable and sturdy. Expensive but would buy again for the comfort.
customer_reviews.author: WargRider

customer_reviews.title: Traction, comfort, with a little ankle support and they keep the stickers and sand out!
customer_reviews.text: Traction, comfort, with a little ankle support and they keep the stickers and sand out. I'm was tired of stopping my walks or work to pick stickers out of my socks and dump sand and gravel out of my shoes and boots. I guessed waterproof boots might be the way to go and I was right! Not any hotter than any other boot with plenty of padding inside.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Libby

customer_reviews.title: nice boots
customer_reviews.text: I would give 5 stars but first pair had some stitches that were missed or pulled loose after 2 weeks. Second pair is perfect so far. Exchange was super easy. 4 years later: Second pair had the same stitches rip after a few months, I kept them anyway. They are pretty worn out by now but still wearable. They’ve been wet for days at a time, full of mud, pretty much whatever abuse you can think of. Walked probably well in excess of 1,000 miles, soles are pretty worn out, they are still comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Booth

customer_reviews.title: Non breathable, make my feet stink!!!
customer_reviews.text: NOT BREATHABLE, they make my feet stink. None of my Gore Tex New Balance boots have ever made my feet stink.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Miller

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof, comfee, not to bad
customer_reviews.text: They're Waterproof, comfee, not to bad if like gluing the sole back on all the time. Had these over 2 yrs now and I think this is the last time I can glue the sole back on. Started about a 8 months after I bought them. They don't make them like they used to. I bought New Balance/Dunham all the time and they lasted for years with no problem. Now you can't get a pair to last a year They lost another costumer.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Bombproof hiking boots for people with duckfeet.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, wide sized, well designed, hiking boots are especially hard to find but, these definitely fit the bill. I tried a few different brands that make wide boots such as Keen, Merrell and Salomon. None really fit that well but the Merrells were the less painful so, I ended up buying a pair of Merrell Moab Gore-tex boots. They were total garbage. Not only were they not very wide, the nylon eyelets ripped out on my first hike. Thankfully Amazon refunded me in full. I then came across these boots. Night and day difference. These boots are bombproof, with steel eyelets and they are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Good for about 1 year with out having to repair. Owned mine since OCT 2018.
customer_reviews.text: These started to come apart at the seem. I have had to repair the rubber with some glue. I will go back to my Merrell's they last much longer on a single purchase before they start to come about.
customer_reviews.author: Casper .

customer_reviews.title: Great boots! Hold up well.
customer_reviews.text: I am disabled. My ankles don't have muscle control so I must wear AFO braces. The size and shape of the foot entry is ideal! I also ride a motorcycle and these boots serve well. Still holding up after 2 years of riding. I already have a backup set in the closet.
customer_reviews.author: Gene R. Wolford Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Best fit hiker I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: Got these for a trip to Colorado. Never ever test fitted them before I left, put them on for a 6-hour hike and my feet were ready for more when I was done. Absolutely love these!
customer_reviews.author: Tbommy

customer_reviews.title: Dunham mid-cut waterproof boots.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a Dunham mid cut waterproof boot in size 10 B . It was to short. Returned them for a 10 1/2 B . When they came it was a 10 B again. Had to send them back also . So now we are without a pair of shoes. Waiting to receive the 10 1/2 B . What can I do about this situation???? Bernice May
customer_reviews.author: Bernice May

customer_reviews.title: These Boots are awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Put them on and within a day they were broke in. This is my second pair, I would buy them again. Very durable boots, wore my first pair for a year and a half, other than showing a little wear on the outside of the boots, they are still good.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Chaney

customer_reviews.title: Numb toe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for myself and my husband for work to replace the mw1569 style we have been using. My left toe went numb and has never come back. I had to return mine. However my husband loves his. I will review his with 5 stars accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Witkowski

product_meta.title: Dunham Men's Cloud Mid Cut Waterproof Boot
product_meta.description: Cloud - nine comfort: Dunham Cloud Midcut Boots in BIG and w - i - d - e (up to 4E) sizes! The comfort of a walking shoe, the durability of a work boot, the aggressive traction and support of a hiker... the Cloud Midcut Boot is a jack-of-all-trades for comfort equally at home on rocky lake shores and mall rotundas. Walking on air: Waterproof leather uppers repel moisture; ROLLBAR with medial and lateral TPU posts for stride-aligning comfort on all terrain; TRU-TRAK multi-directional lug outsole provides aggressive traction; Tectonic Tongue engineered foam flexes at the 3 main foot "flex zones" for evenly distributed pressure and comfort with each step; Premium foam insert gently conforms to the foot to disperse shock and pressure; Each approx. 18 ozs.; State Size and Width. Order Today! Men's Dunham Cloud Midcut Boots Hit the trails in Dunham's Addison hiking boot. The waterproof leather upper features sturdy seams, strong laces and a rubber-reinforced toe guard. Its mid-cut collar offers great ankle support, while aggressive tread on the durable rubber outsole helps to keep you grounded on tricky terrain.
